<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Represent a range of possible values that may occur when the program is run</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for an integral value.  This keeps track of a lower and upper bound for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// constant, which MAY wrap around the end of the numeric range.  To do this, it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// keeps track of a &#91;lower, upper) bound, which specifies an interval just like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// STL iterators.  When used with boolean values, the following are important</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ranges: :</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;F, F) = &#123;&#125;     = Empty set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;T, F) = &#123;T&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;F, T) = &#123;F&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  &#91;T, T) = &#123;F, T&#125; = Full set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The other integral ranges use min/max values for special range values. For</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// example, for 8-bit types, it uses:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;0, 0)     = &#123;&#125;       = Empty set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;255, 255) = &#123;0..255&#125; = Full Set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that ConstantRange can be used to represent either signed or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unsigned ranges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Produce the smallest range such that all values that may satisfy the given</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// predicate with any value contained within Other is contained in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// returned range.  Formally, this returns a superset of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;union over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;.  If the exact</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value will be a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// proper superset of the above.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 &#91;2, 5) returns Result = &#91;0, 4)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> makeAllowedICmpRegion(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">CmpInst::Predicate</a> Pred,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Produce the largest range such that all values in the returned range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// satisfy the given predicate with all values contained within Other.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Formally, this returns a subset of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;intersection over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;.  If the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// exact answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be a proper subset of the above.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 &#91;2, 5) returns &#91;0, 2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Produce the exact range such that all values in the returned range satisfy</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#123; x : icmp op x y is true&#125;&#39;.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Produce the largest range containing all X such that &quot;X BinOp Y&quot; is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// guaranteed not to wrap (overflow) for &#42;all&#42; Y in Other. However, there may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be &#42;some&#42; Y in Other for which additional X not contained in the result</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// also do not overflow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NoWrapKind must be one of OBO::NoUnsignedWrap or OBO::NoSignedWrap.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Examples:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  typedef OverflowingBinaryOperator OBO;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  #define MGNR makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;-128, 127)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == &#91;0, -1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 0, 1), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == Full Set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 -1, 6), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;INT&#95;MIN+1, INT&#95;MAX-4)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Sub, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;-127, 128)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  MGNR(Sub, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == &#91;1, 0)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#ac26154a24f393f523c87cc5f8239f36c">Instruction::BinaryOps</a> BinOp,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If represented precisely, the result of some range operations may consist</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of multiple disjoint ranges. As only a single range may be returned, any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// range covering these disjoint ranges constitutes a valid result, but some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// may be more useful than others depending on context. The preferred range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// type specifies whether a range that is non-wrapping in the unsigned or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// signed domain, or has the smallest size, is preferred. If a signedness is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// preferred but all ranges are non-wrapping or all wrapping, then the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// smallest set size is preferred. If there are multiple smallest sets, any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// one of them may be returned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082">PreferredRangeType</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a25a373cd66e09df5cb7b8cf3f443ea2b">Smallest</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082ade1662f5186fd8852b4dcce8eb6563bc">Unsigned</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a8260f3d302e2463fd93753dfd0de6ec1">Signed</a> &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the range that results from the intersection of this range with</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the range that results from the union of this range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with another range.  The resultant range is guaranteed to include the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// elements of both sets, but may contain more.  For example, &#91;3, 9) union</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;12,15) is &#91;3, 15), which includes 9, 10, and 11, which were not included</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in either set before.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> unionWith(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp;CR,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Intersect the two ranges and return the result if it can be represented</Highlight></CodeLine>
